title: Bug 35156: Ctrl+F1 does not work on some fields in the help search
description: When using Ctrl+F1 in the help search, it only works on some fields.
OB: Ctrl+F1 does not work on some fields in the help search.
EB: Ctrl+F1 should work on all fields in the help search.
SR:
OS: Linux
Build: RC2 with IBMJava2131 JRE

Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch Eclipse with DBCS locale.
2. From the menu bar, select Search > Help.
3. When the window pops up, click on the first text field and press Ctrl+F1.

Expected Result:
A help pop-up screen should appear, displaying information about the HelpSearch.

Actual Result:
Nothing happens.

Additional Comments:
1. This issue occurs in all DBCS languages.
2. The issue only occurs in the first text field. When cycling through all the other fields using the tab key, Ctrl+F1 functions properly and displays the correct information.
3. Please refer to the attachment for a visual representation of the field that is not responding to Ctrl+F1; it is circled in red. The fields circled in green are working properly.
